replies.bodyText:
Yeah I just hate MVP.
You could do Presenter.fetchData, View.renderData(LiveData<>). It'll leak some logic though. When it comes down to it LiveData is a MVVM component, it is not meant to be used like this.
You could put the logic in the Presenter and return types Result(List<>) NoResults but it just isn't as cool when it isn't kotlin sealed classes, in java you are reduced to using instanceOf. MediatorLiveData exists for this case.
